sentences.english: He diligently worked hard to perform his duties and at the same time he dedicated himself to self-educate himself.
sentences.chinese: 年輕的火炎在努力工作之餘，也不忘了勤力自修。

sentences.english: A team of dedicated and competent individuals is our most valuable asset.
sentences.chinese: 團隊中的每個勤力成員是我們最爲珍貴的資產。

sentences.english: Management should be diligent in looking for factors that indicate a need for employee training.
sentences.chinese: 管理者應該勤力尋找員工培訓需求的指示。

sentences.english: From work to go to work, and so on, the boss to do some hard on it.
sentences.chinese: 上班就等下班，老闆來就做做勤力的樣子。

sentences.english: He is the hardest working person in the company.
sentences.chinese: 他是全公司最勤力的人。

definition: all day long/the whole day/the whole time
(of a wife) wise and kind/perfect in her traditional roles
to sleep (Cantonese)/Mandarin equivalent: 睡覺|睡觉[shui4 jiao4]
to earn one's living (Cantonese)/Mandarin equivalent: 謀生|谋生[mou2 sheng1]
to knock off work for the day
to fail to pay sufficient attention to/to be negligent in regard to/to be lacking in
second month of a season/middle/intermediate/second amongst brothers
